Very strong level one due to his shotgun knees. He can 100 to 0 any enemy champion by running circles around them if they are careless, and get an early lead.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}} allows him to be an excellent tank buster during late-game fights. It also acts as a great finisher from a large range, especially on unsuspecting enemies.

His early game is quite strong which is only increased once he gets his Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}}. The strength also increases once he manages to get his first two items.

He becomes vulnerable when his {{championSpells.UrgotQ}} and {{championSpells.UrgotE}} are down in the lane. Besides that, he is susceptible to poke in the lane if he happens to be against a ranged laner.

Falls off during the late game due to his enemies building defensive items and such. Besides that, his Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}} can easily be cleansed with a Quicksilver Sash, thereby negating the threat of the ability.

Extremely immobile when his {{championSpells.UrgotE}} is down, arguably making it the best time to trade with him. Even in team fights, if he tries to go in with this ability, he can be finished off quickly.

Your goal in the early game is to take calculated trades while fighting the enemy. Use your range advantage where suitable to bully annd gain a lead.

Once you have quite a few levels under your belt, you should look for short favourable trades. You may wish to wait for the enemy to waste an ability before playing aggressive.

Keep the minion wave closer to your side of the map in the early game. This will ensure safety and reduce your chances of dying in lane.

Urgot's early game is pretty good, especially once he gains access to all his basic abilities. He can easily all-in an enemy and then proceed to destroy them with his Passive and auto-attacks.

Urgot's level six is solid as it lets him execute his targets when they are below a certain health threshold. This is really good when trying to deal with tanks.

Urgot's first item component will be beneficial as it will boost his overall damage and survivability in the lane. It will be instrumental when combined with the regular usage of the lane brushes by Urgot.

Split push during the mid-game and try to secure side objectives. Avoid grouping when your Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}} is down.

Group with your team when your Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}} is up. Rotate from the side lane to wherever your team is and look for a pick with your Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}}.

Peel for your allies in team fights. As you’re a tank, you’re rather weak unless your carries are alive. Thus, keeping them alive is key in team fights. Be prepared to peel for them when necessary.

His first ability will be maxed out at level 9. This will give him a significant damage boost, and Urgot should impact skirmishes very easily.

Having two points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}} will increase the damage dealt by the ability, reduce the cooldown, and make it easier for him to execute his targets.

Urgot is really strong during the mid-game due to his team fighting presence. He can easily zone out and separate the enemy frontline from its backline. He will also be able to deal consistent DPS.

Peel for your carries in late game team fights to increase the chances of your team winning the fight. If they die at the beginning, you will not be able to win the fight alone.

Stick with your team in the late game. Do not split up or walk away from them otherwise the enemy may try to pick you off or initiate a 4v5 fight when you’re away from your team.

Focus the nearest enemy champion to your carries and work as a team to take down the enemy one by one. If you focus the backline alone, you may be an easy target for the enemy and may die quickly. By focusing on the nearest champion, you will survive for longer and keep your carries alive.

Three points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.UrgotR}} will make Urgot really scary. Anyone who gets caught out by Urgot will probably end up dying due to the sheer amount of damage he can dish out in a short time.

Urgot is really tanky during the late game. Due to his items, he will have a respectable amount of sustain, which will make it really hard for the enemy to kill him.

Team fights will be Urgot's bread and butter as he can front line quite effectively while dishing out tons of damage to the enemy team. He can also separate the enemy team's front line from the backline, negating the threat of all-ins on his team.

Can use his {{championSpells.VarusQ}} to poke the enemy while securing minions from afar. If he uses his {{championSpells.VarusQ}} to push and poke at the same time, he is making good use of his mana.

Has built-in Grevious Wounds with his {{championSpells.VarusE}}. This will reduce the enemies healing in the lane and in team fights too.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} gives Varuus a ton of playmaking and pick potential for his team.

Varus is prone to all-in as he has no dash. If the enemy layers CC on him, he is going to die very quickly.

Varus’ only self-peel tool is his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. When it is down, he can easily be all-in’d by a strong enemy laner.

If Varus falls behind early, he is going to struggle to get back into the game: regardless of his build.

Focus on poking down the opposition with your {{championSpells.VarusQ}} and {{championSpells.VarusW}}. It should be pretty easy for you once you slow them down with your {{championSpells.VarusE}}.

You are highly immobile so it should be important for you to take some countermeasures against ganks. Ward around the lane and keep the wave on your side when possible.

Farm a lot and get your core items quickly. This will help you get kills and burst down enemies with your obnoxious {{championSpells.VarusQ}} damage.

Varus’ {{championSpells.VarusQ}} poke during the laning phase is pretty strong. If he aims his {{championSpells.VarusQ}} on the minion wave and the enemy at the same time, he will make great use of his mana.

At level 6, Varus can setup his Jungler with his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. A good Varus will look to poke the enemy down and then get their Jungler to gank to shut down the enemy Mid laner.

Varus' first item is going to give him a huge power spike. This simply means that his burst damage combo will do a lot of damage and can completely destroy any immobile or CC’d enemy champion.

Once you get your Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}, you should be able to make picks all around the map with your teammates. Work with your Jungler to do so when possible.

During neutral objective fights, you should be able to disrupt a fight due to your Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}, especially if the enemy is clumped. Just make sure that you land the ability.

Try to land your {{championSpells.VarusQ}} regularly on multiple people of the enemy team. This will force them to play safely and your team can later all-in them and finish the job.

At level 11, Varus will be able to add 2 points into his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. This makes it really easy for Varus to pick off enemies, especially when Varus is trying to swap lanes.

His first ability will be maxed out at level 9. This will allow him to deal a lot of damage to his opponents in the lane. It will also provide him the incentive to carry for his team if he is already ahead.

Varus' AoE poke and Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} make clumped fights disastrous for the enemy team. They will suffer if Varus manages to get an excellent Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} during neutral, objective fights.

As you get your items, you should have a really easy time blowing enemies up with ease. Set some deep wards to facilitate long-ranged {{championSpells.VarusQ}}s on the enemy team.

Your {{championSpells.VarusE}} and {{championSpells.VarusW}} will be really beneficial during actual fights as the Grievous Wounds and the slow should disrupt the enemy heavily. This will make your team win fights easily.

A defensive item may help you a lot in this matchup, especially if you are going for an AP build. Just make sure that you don't stay too far away from your allies.

At level 16, Varus will be able to add 3 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. It will increase the damage dealt by the ability while simultaneously reducing the cooldown.

Varus will have a lot of items during this stage of the game. This will let him dish out a lot of damage, and his burst potential due to his {{championSpells.VarusW}} will be phenomenal.

Varus is excellent in team fights due to his {{championSpells.VarusQ}} and Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. A good Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} can literally allow Varus' team to win a significant battle with minimal effort.

Can stay safe while poking and farming with his {{championSpells.VarusQ}} from a really long distance. This poke can be really obnoxious for the enemy team and will send them scampering. Helps him in covering up his weakness due to his immobile nature.

Has inbuilt Grievous Wound in his kit. His {{championSpells.VarusE}} slows as well, which makes it really easy for him to deal with healers and engage Support champions. This can be really advantageous in a team fight.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} provides utility for his team and can allow him to get key picks which will help him close out the game. The projectile moves swiftly so it is quite easy to land as well.

Very immobile and can be easily killed if crowd control is layered on him. All-in Supports hiding in a lane brush while waiting for him will naturally zone him off the minion wave.

Extremely vulnerable while his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} is down. He can be flanked with ease as well and assassin’s can easily get rid of him if his team forgets to peel for him.

Improper usage of his {{championSpells.VarusE}} can lead to lost team fights. In lane, using his {{championSpells.VarusE}} improperly will allow any form of enchanter and mage Support to walk up to him and poke him down with ease.

Play safe for the first few levels. You need time to come online and you shouldn’t be fighting unless you have a clear early advantage.

Constantly push and poke the enemy with your abilities. Once they’re low, you can look for an aggressive all-in. However, while kills are nice, your goal is to poke and not commit to fights.

After destroying the bottom lane tower, rotate to the mid lane and try to take that tower. This will open up the map and give your team a gold lead.

His {{championSpells.VarusQ}} poke is powerful during the early game. Depending on the build, the poke amount will vary, but it is his most reliable poke spell in the lane.

Once he hits level six, his kill pressure skyrockets. He can now use his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} to CC enemy champions and then work with his Support to layer CC on the said target.

Varus' first item is going to give him a huge power spike. This simply means that his burst damage combo will do a lot of damage and can completely destroy any immobile or CC'd carry.

Try and stick with your Support throughout the mid-game. You’re quite vulnerable and easy to kill if you’re on your own. By staying with your Support, your survivability will increase.

Continue picking up farm in the side lanes when no team fights are occurring, but spend as little time away from your team. You need gold and XP to buy items and if you fall behind, it will be unlikely that you’ll be able to dish out damage in fights.

Look for picks with your Support/Jungler to get kills and increase your lead. If you kill a key target, you could make the call for Baron.

At level 11, Varus will be able to add 2 points into his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. This makes it really easy for Varus to pick off enemies, especially when Varus is trying to swap lanes.

His first ability will be maxed out at level 9. This will allow him to deal a lot of damage to his opponents in the lane. It will also provide him the incentive to carry for his team if he is already ahead.

Varus' AoE poke and Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} make clumped fights disastrous for the enemy team. They will suffer if Varus manages to get an excellent Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} during neutral, objective fights.

Just like in the mid-game, you should stick with your Support throughout the later parts of the game. Do not go around the map alone as you will die easily.

Do not play super aggressive in team fights. Just kite and auto-attack the nearest enemy champion. If you walk too far forward, the enemy will focus you and take you down.

Continue to kite in team fights and consistently adapt your positioning. Avoid standing still in fights as you’ll be an easy target.

At level 16, Varus will be able to add 3 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. It will increase the damage dealt by the ability while simultaneously reducing the cooldown.

Varus will have a lot of items during this stage of the game. This will let him dish out a lot of damage, and his burst potential due to his {{championSpells.VarusW}} will be phenomenal.

Varus is excellent in team fights due to his {{championSpells.VarusQ}} and Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}}. A good Ultimate {{championSpells.VarusR}} can literally allow Varus' team to win a significant battle with minimal effort.

Scales extremely well into the late game and can single-handedly carry a game if the game lasts for that long. She can even duel enemy champs due to her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} mobility.

Extreme mobility allows her to both dodge skillshots, and play defensively at the same time. This can be extremely obnoxious for the enemy, especially when Vayne is using her Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}}.

Her {{championSpells.VayneSilveredBolts}} is a real game-changer for her as she can use it to completely win extended trades against other laners. It also allows her to cut through tanks’ health bar like butter.

Mechanically challenging to play as one mistake/misstep can get her killed immediately. Crowd control is her mortal enemy and her enemies can get rid of her as soon as she is crowd controlled.

Quite vulnerable in team fights without her Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}}. She needs the invisibility in order to juke her enemies, otherwise, she can’t really do much other than completely rely on her team.

She is very weak during the early game and hence can easily be shut down with constant ganks from the enemy team. Her short-range doesn’t help her either so the enemy can camp this lane with ease.

Play safe for the first few levels. You need time to come online and you shouldn’t be fighting unless you have a clear early advantage.

Once you have a few levels under your belt, you can start to play aggressive and look for aggressive plays. However, you will rely on your Support to do the heavy lifting early on. 

After destroying the bottom lane tower, rotate to the mid lane and try to take that tower. This will open up the map and give your team a gold lead.

Vayne needs a lot of time to scale due to the nature of her kit. The farther she goes into the game, the greater her chances of solo carrying her team to victory.

Level six is a massive early game spike as she can now look for aggressive all-ins on the enemy. It is effortless for Vayne to bamboozle the enemies now due to her invisibility.

The first item component will surely give Vayne a massive boost in dueling. She will need to use the lane brushes to ensure that she can compensate for her short range.

Try and stick with your Support throughout the mid-game. You’re quite vulnerable and easy to kill if you’re on your own. By staying with your Support, your survivability will increase.

Continue picking up farm in the side lanes when no team fights are occurring, but spend as little time away from your team. You need gold and XP to buy items and if you fall behind, it will be unlikely that you’ll be able to dish out damage in fights.

Look for picks with your Support/Jungler to get kills and increase your lead. If you kill a key target, you could make the call for Baron.

Her first ability will be maxed out at level nine. From this point, she will start hitting like a truck as her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} will be up very quickly in the game.

Getting two points in her Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}} will cause her to spike again. It will help her a lot in team fights, especially when the enemy team is filled with heavy CC champions.

She will have her core items by now, which means that she will deal a respectable amount of damage. She can even duel enemies and won't need her Support to babysit her if she masters her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} usage.

Just like in the mid-game, you should stick with your Support throughout the later parts of the game. Do not go around the map alone as you will die easily.

Do not play super aggressive in team fights. Just kite and auto-attack the nearest enemy champion. If you walk too far forward, the enemy will focus you and take you down.

Continue to kite in team fights and consistently adapt your positioning. Avoid standing still in fights as you’ll be an easy target.

Vayne shines during the late game as she can run down enemies due to her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} and {{championSpells.VayneSilveredBolts}}. All she needs to do is to avoid getting CC'd.

A fully maxed out Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}} will give a massive power spike to Vayne. This is absolutely necessary to win the game and will allow Vayne to dish out tons of damage.

Vayne will have multiple items by now, which means that she will be hitting enemies like a truck. A defensive item should allow her to solidify her position as the primary carry of the team.

Vayne will have the range advantage in the lane in most matchups. She will be able to abuse the enemy and deny them from the farm.

Vayne scales incredibly well into the later parts of the game. As long as she isn’t behind, she will be really good in the late game.

She is magnificent versus tank teams and tank champions, thanks to her {{championSpells.VayneSilveredBolts}}.

If the enemy has lots of CC, it will be hard for Vayne to do too much as she can easily get shut down by CC.

If Vayne falls behind in the early game, you will find it hard to do well in the later stages of the game. 

She is mechanically challenging to play as one mistake/misstep can get her killed immediately. Crowd control is her mortal enemy, and her enemies can get rid of her as soon as she is crowd controlled.

Go for regular short trades with your {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} > auto-attack in this lane. You may want to use the lane brushes quite liberally for this purpose.

Your {{championSpells.VayneCondemn}} will be your best friend in the lane if you're dealing with a tank early on. Ensure that you save it from getting the enemy away from you if they manage to land their CC on you.

Getting your Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}} will help you a lot and will allow you to mince through tanks quite easily. Just ensure that your positioning is correct.

Vayne has great trading potential but needs a lot of time to scale due to the nature of her kit. The longer the game goes, the greater her chances of solo carrying her team to victory.

Level six is a massive early game spike as she can now look for aggressive all-ins on the enemy. It is effortless for Vayne to bamboozle the enemy top laner now due to her invisibility. She can even use it to evade ganks.

The first item component will surely give Vayne a massive boost in dueling. She will need to use the lane brushes to ensure that she can compensate for her short range.

Your main goal is to scale up during this phase of the game. You should be fighting more frequently, though, as you will be hurting a lot once your core items are completed.

During fights, always stick with your team as you want to be protected while damaging enemies. Avoid getting pinned near a wall while doing so, though.

When fighting for neutral objectives, it is important to stay back and wait for the enemy team to pass through the choke points before going for a full all-in on them. Let your front liners engage before doing anything.

Her first ability will be maxed out at level nine. From this point, she will start hitting like a truck as her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} will be up very quickly in the game. This and her {{championSpells.VayneCondemn}} will make it impossible for a single enemy top laner to catch her.

Getting two points in her Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}} will cause her to spike again. It will help her a lot in team fights, especially when the enemy team is filled with heavy CC champions.

She will have her core items by now, which means that she will deal a respectable amount of damage. She can even duel enemies if she masters her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} usage.

You should be able to slice through the entire enemy team like a hot butter knife. Just make sure that you don't misposition and get caught out while doing so, though.

You may work with your team to get picks in the enemy Jungle, but you should try your best to be in a side lane and chase down careless enemies who decide to farm the sidewave.

Getting a defensive item should help you increase your survivability against burst damage and assassination attempts. Use your Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}} invisibility wisely as well since it can bamboozle enemies quite easily if used properly.

Vayne shines during the late game as she can run down enemies due to her {{championSpells.VayneTumble}} and {{championSpells.VayneSilveredBolts}}. All she needs to do is to avoid getting CC'd.

A fully maxed out Ultimate {{championSpells.VayneInquisition}} will give a massive power spike to Vayne. This is absolutely necessary to win the game and will allow Vayne to dish out tons of damage.

Vayne will have multiple items by now, which means that she will be hitting enemies like a truck. A defensive item should allow her to solidify her position as the primary carry of the team.

Infinite scaling on his Passive makes him a late-game monster. He can quite easily start one-shotting people once he manages to get his first item.

Extremely powerful when fighting in closed spaces as he can easily land his {{championSpells.VeigarBalefulStrike}} and {{championSpells.VeigarDarkMatter}} on multiple targets while crowd controlling them with his {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}}.

Very high gank set-up potential with his {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}}. This can allow him to call his Jungler to gank his lane and help him get an early lead, which will be quite devastating for the enemy team.

Very immobile and is extremely vulnerable to crowd control. He has a weak early game as well, so he can easily be abused and killed with a few ganks.

His {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} is on a really long cooldown, and it is his only form of self-peel. Once it is down, he can be easily all-in’d and killed with crowd control.

He will take a lot of time to come online if he happens to get killed a few times during the early game. He isn’t going to be very effective if the game goes on for too long so try to shut him down early and end the game quickly.

Play safe for the first few levels. You need time to come online and you shouldn’t be fighting unless you have a clear early advantage.

Once you have a few levels under your belt, you can start to play aggressive and look for aggressive plays. However, you will rely on your Support to do the heavy lifting early on. 

After destroying the bottom lane tower, rotate to the mid lane and try to take that tower. This will open up the map and give your team a gold lead.

Veigar is relatively weak during the early game, and he should be focusing on trying to {{championSpells.VeigarBalefulStrike}} and stack up his Passive when possible. His {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} will come in handy when trying to prevent all-ins.

Post-six, he will have access to all his basic abilities. This is huge for him as he can now CC enemies and then combo them with his {{championSpells.VeigarDarkMatter}} and {{championSpells.VeigarBalefulStrike}} when possible.

Level six is a significant power spike as it gives him access to his finishing ability. Now he will just have to focus on poking the enemy out in the lane before decimating them with his Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}}.

At this stage of the game, you want to put yourself in a side lane and focus on getting stacks so you have a stronger late game.

In the later parts of the mid-game and when the enemy starts to group, make sure you follow suit and start to group with your team.

Look for picks with your {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}}. If you can catch someone out during the mid game with it, your team should be able to kill them pretty quickly. Once you’ve killed someone, make the call for Drake or Baron.

His first ability will be maxed out at level nine. Now he can pretty much do a quarter of a squishy target's health bar with his {{championSpells.VeigarBalefulStrike}}.

At level 11, he will have two points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}}. This will amplify his damage massively, and Veigar will easily be able to one-shot squishy enemies and tanks alike.

Veigar will now have multiple stacks, which will grant him a lot of free ability power. This is horrible news for the enemy team as Veigar will soon be unstoppable.

Stick with your team in the late game. Do not split up or walk away from them otherwise the enemy may try to pick you off or initiate a 4v5 fight when you’re away from your team.

Look for a pick with your {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} to gain the numbers advantage. Then use your Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} to take them down quickly before looking to siege or take a nearby objective.

At this stage of the game, you should have tons of stacks and be really strong. If you’re ahead, use your Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} to stat check the squishiest enemy champion to take them out of the fight.

He will have a lot of Passive stacks during this phase of the game. This scaling is infinite, which means that Veigar can pretty much one-shot full health squishy targets.

His {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} will be on a very short cooldown during this point in the game. He will be able to secure a lot of picks, especially around choke points.

Once his Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} gets maxed out, he will execute enemies with ease. Any enemy who gets hit by his {{championSpells.VeigarBalefulStrike}} will be within Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} kill range of Veigar.

Your champion is incredibly weak in the early game. Focus on farming and avoid fighting with the enemy until you’ve got an item behind you.

After your bot lane has moved to the mid lane, rotate to the bot side of the map or somewhere else on the map so you can continue to farm and gain XP. Do not fight anyone unless you have an advantage over them. Continue to get XP and gold.

Very immobile and is extremely vulnerable to crowd control. He has a weak early game as well, so he can easily be abused and killed with a few ganks.

His {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} is on a really long cooldown, and it is his only form of self-peel. Once it is down, he can be easily all-in’d and killed with crowd control.

He will take a lot of time to come online if he happens to get killed a few times during the early game. He isn’t going to be very effective if the game goes on for too long so try to shut him down early and end the game quickly.

The lane brushes are to be occupied by you, and you will want to land poke from within them whenever possible. Maintain your distance from the enemy as well since you're immobile and will get killed easily.

Your {{championSpells.VeigarDarkMatter}} and {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} are going to be instrumental in winning this lane. Always CC the enemy target before going in for a trade to ensure that no one can turn on you.

Getting your Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} is a massive power spike in the lane and one which will let you take over the game with ease. Don't hesitate to use the ability on low-health enemy champions, even if it means stealing a kill.

Level three is a decent power spike as Veigar can trap his enemies and then pelt them with his abilities. A full rotation of his basic abilities will deal a good amount of damage to his target.

Level 6 is a significant power spike as Veigar gets access to his Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}}, which is a really great finishing move. It will help him take over the game later on.

The first item will be a significant power spike as well. This is because his AP will be increased, which, combined with his Passive, will allow him to have more AP than most other players.

You will have your core items now, which means that you will be hitting like a truck. When in the lane, make sure you keep stacking your Passive up frequently. It is vital for the late game.

Not showing up to neutral, objective fights will be a cardinal sin that you want to avoid. All your abilities make it very hard for the enemy team to be concentrated near the pit, hence use it to your advantage.

If the enemy happens to be too mobile or CC-heavy, just get a defensive item like a Zhonya's Hourglass. It will keep you safe from getting one shot before being able to do anything.

Veigar's {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} will be maxed out by level 9, which will allow him to trap targets more frequently and deal a hefty amount of damage to them. The lane brushes should be used for this purpose.

He will have two points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} at level 11. This will allow him to blow up enemies with ease as the game progresses.

Veigar's core items will be completed during this stage of the game. This means that any enemy he manages to CC will be taking a lot of damage in return and may probably even die if they were low on health.

Your complete build will allow you to kill squishy targets with one {{championSpells.VeigarBalefulStrike}} and Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}}. Moreso, your Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} will be up frequently, hence use it liberally.

Try to CC multiple targets at a time during this phase of the game. Your AoE damage potential is really high and can completely wipe out a team if you time it well.

Do not wander about alone in unwarded areas of the map. You are already immobile, and anyone with a dash or spell shield can kill you. Stick with your team and work with them to one-shot enemies.

Level 16 is a massive power spike as Veigar will have his Ultimate {{championSpells.VeigarR}} maxed out during the game. It can actually allow him to one-shot enemies if he has enough AP.

Veigar will have multiple items by now. He should be focusing on fighting around chokepoints regularly. This simply means that he can destroy enemies if he manages to catch them off-guard.

His {{championSpells.VeigarEventHorizon}} cooldown will be really low, meaning that Veigar can get frequent picks on crucial targets and peel for his team simultaneously. This is quite important for someone as immobile as Veigar.

His poke damage is quite high and obnoxious for the enemy team to deal with. This poke can build up over time and makes it so that the enemy laner is forced to play in the cover of their minion wave.

His wave clearing potential is very high due to his {{championSpells.VelkozW}} and {{championSpells.VelkozQ}}. This allows him to clear up the waves pretty quickly and get lane priority, which allows him to help his team secure objectives.

Excels in fights taking place in chokepoints and close quarters as it allows him to quickly stack up his Passive. This combined with his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} can easily allow him to destroy the enemy team.

Very immobile and hence is vulnerable to layered crowd control. He can’t push up freely unless he already knows where the enemy Jungler is, otherwise, he will just be killed.

His {{championSpells.VelkozE}} is his only source of self-peel. Misusing it makes him way more vulnerable to all-ins and can probably get him killed almost instantly if the enemy laner has some form of blink or ranged crowd control ability.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} roots him in place, making it very easy for enemy champions with ranged crowd control to interrupt his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} and get on top of him along with their team.

Harass the enemy throughout the laning phase with your {{championSpells.VelkozW}} and {{championSpells.VelkozQ}}. Your goal is to constantly harass the enemy whenever possible and get kills.

After destroying the bottom lane tower, rotate to the mid lane and try to take that tower. This will open up the map and give your team a gold lead. Poke and harass the enemy Mid laner and force them away from the objective to make it easier to secure the mid lane tower.

Whenever your Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} is up, try to use it on the enemy lakers to get their health low. Ideally, poke them down first before using it to make it easier for you to kill the enemy.

Vel'Koz's level 6 is a massive powerspike as it lets him utilize his Passive fully. It is a great finishing ability that is best used against enemies who are clumped together.

His first item will give a massive boost to his overall effectiveness in the lane. It will increase his burst damage combo, and he can force enemies to recall abruptly quite frequently in the lane.

The greater the number of points in his {{championSpells.VelkozQ}}, the greater his poke potential and overall damage output. Since his {{championSpells.VelkozQ}} can slow targets, it can allow Vel'Koz to completely CC the enemy and destroy them.

Try to delay team fights for as long as possible while you harass the enemy and poke them down with your {{championSpells.VelkozQ}}. If you can get them low, then you can commit to the team fight.

Keep a constant eye on what major objective is spawning next. If it’s spawning soon, make sure you place vision around the objective as quickly and as safely as possible before retreating to safety. Having vision around major objectives is key.

As a Support, you’re quite vulnerable and can easily be killed when going to ward, when you’re moving around the map, and when you’re alone. To reduce the chances of dying and getting caught out of position, try and stick with your team at all times.

Vel'Koz will have his {{championSpells.VelkozQ}} maxed at level 9. This means that he will deal more poke damage and completely dismantle an enemy team from range.

He will have two points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} once he hits level 11. This means that Vel'Koz will use the Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} more efficiently as a finishing move to get rid of low health targets.

Team fights are going to be really good for Vel'Koz due to his kit. If he manages to score a knock upon a target, he will probably kill them instantly with his team.

Ward major objectives and place vision in high traffic areas in the late stages of the game. Keep them warded so you can see the enemy move around the map and see them starting the objective.

Stay with your team at all times. Avoid moving around the map alone so you do not get caught out. Getting caught out will result in your team having to play 4v5. Do not ward alone unless you know where the enemy is.

Peel for your allies as much as possible. Keeping them alive for as long as possible in team fights is a must in order to win the game.

At level 16, Vel'Koz will have his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} maxed out. This means that he can now deal tons of damage from far away even if he gets one stack of his Passive on his enemy.

His damage output will be really high due to the number of items he possesses at that point in the game. He should focus on using the fog of war to poke out enemies first.

Vel'Koz will be extremely good in team fights, especially fights where he is playing around choke points. This means that he can apply his Passive stacks on multiple enemies, making it easier for him to kill a bunch of enemies together.

His poke damage is quite high and obnoxious for the enemy team to deal with. This poke can build up over time and makes it so that the enemy laner is forced to play in the cover of their minion wave.

His wave clearing potential is very high due to his {{championSpells.VelkozW}} and {{championSpells.VelkozQ}}. This allows him to clear up the waves pretty quickly and get lane priority, which allows him to help his team secure objectives.

Excels in fights taking place in chokepoints and close quarters as it allows him to quickly stack up his Passive. This combined with his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} can easily allow him to destroy the enemy team.

Very immobile and hence is vulnerable to layered crowd control. He can’t push up freely unless he already knows where the enemy Jungler is, otherwise, he will just be killed.

His {{championSpells.VelkozE}} is his only source of self-peel. Misusing it makes him way more vulnerable to all-ins and can probably get him killed almost instantly if the enemy laner has some form of blink or ranged crowd control ability.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} roots him in place, making it very easy for enemy champions with ranged crowd control to interrupt his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} and get on top of him along with their team.

Your goal throughout the laning phase is to poke and harass the enemy in lane. You have a lot of poke, so try to poke the enemy down as often as you can.

Play safe for the first few levels while you land poke on the enemy with your {{championSpells.VelkozQ}}. Once they’re low enough, you can commit to an all-in.

Once you’ve hit level 6 and purchased key component items, look to harass and constantly push the enemy into their tower. This will allow you to earn turret plating and increase your gold income.

His level six is a massive power spike as he can now use his Passive to the utmost potential. He will just have to ensure that he doesn't root himself in a position where an enemy can flank him.

His first item component will be beneficial as it will allow him to use his {{championSpells.VelkozW}} frequently to wave clear. This will allow him to prevent the enemy laner from roaming freely.

Before level six, Vel'Koz should stick to keeping the wave on his side of the tower due to his squishiness. His combo is relatively ineffective, too, without his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}}.

If your allies move to your lane after destroying their tower, rotate and move around the map to continue farming and gaining XP and gold.

Use your abilities to clear the minion waves quickly so your team can siege/ prevent a siege from the enemy team. If you can land poke while also pushing the minion wave, you could look for a favourable trade.

While sieging Baron or Dragon, or whenever you’re pushing the enemy under their tower, look for a pick with your abilities. If you can catch someone out of position or blow them up, you’ll be able to take the objective for free.

Vel'Koz is enormous in team fights, especially the ones which happen near the objective pits. This is mainly because clumped fights allow Vel'Koz to hit multiple targets with his abilities and proc his Passive.

Getting 2 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} at level 11 will be another significant power spike. He can now melt through the enemy backline and frontline alike with all the damage he will deal.

More items mean more damage for Vel'Koz. This will only make things better for him, and his team and Vel'Koz will slowly start taking over the game from here.

Stick with your team in the late game. Do not split up or walk away from them otherwise the enemy may try to pick you off or initiate a 4v5 fight when you’re away from your team.

Look for picks with your abilities. Picking someone off and then collapsing on them to take them down is a great way of winning a team fight and ending the game. Look for picks on isolated targets if possible.

Keep a constant eye on you and your allies positioning. You need to poke the enemy down and delay fights in the late game, but you need to watch your positioning as you move forward to harass. Do not get picked off by trying to harass and poke the enemy down.

Having 3 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}} is another significant power spike for Vel'Koz. This will allow him to melt through everyone like a hot butter knife. His burst damage will be immaculate as well.

Vel'Koz is good in team fights during this game due to his Passive and Ultimate {{championSpells.VelkozR}}. That, in combination with the rest of his abilities, make up for some obnoxious poke damage.

Having his complete build will allow Vel'Koz to burst people down like balloons. Any squishy who gets caught in the crossfire will definitely end up dying.

Vex has a shield on her {{championSpells.VexW}} that can protect her from incoming damage.

Really good wave clear with her {{championSpells.VexQ}} and {{championSpells.VexE}}.

Great pick potential with her Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}} which can also be used to help her roam to other lanes.

Maximizing damage output can be really difficult on Vex, especially when laning against champions with dashes.

Even with her {{championSpells.VexW}}, she still struggles against some all-in champions.

While she has good wave clear, she can get out pushed and out poked by champions with superior range and damage.

You will want to focus on wave clearing and conserving mana during the early game. Your {{championSpells.VexQ}} has a vast range and hitbox, so make sure that you target both minions and the enemy simultaneously.

Keep track of your Passive timer as it is the difference between a won fight and a lost one. If the enemy relies on diving you, {{championSpells.VexW}} them to fear them and reposition quickly.

Unlocking your Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}} will allow you to roam around freely after shoving the wave in. See if you can catch the enemies in the side lane and burst them down.

Once Vex hits level 3 and gets access to each of her abilities, she could look to play aggressively and make a play.

Unlocking Vex’s Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}} at level 6 is a valuable power spike for her. Expect her to play more aggressively when her Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}} is on cooldown.

Earning enough gold for her first component item offers her extra trading potential in lane. Her damage output will increase and she will be stronger after this.

Skirmishes should be accessible for you as long as you land your {{championSpells.VexQ}} on multiple targets. This also means that clumped fights will be the win condition for you.

Show up to neutral, objective fights whenever you get the chance. The goal is to use your AoE-based abilities to catch and kill targets who try to disrupt your Jungler.

Use your Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}} wisely and combine your {{championSpells.VexW}} with your Passive whenever possible. This can easily allow you to dive into the enemy backline.

Once she reaches level 9, she will max her first ability. This is very impactful and will make Vex a lot stronger in lane.

At level 11, Vex will put a second point in her Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}}. She will be much more of a threat at this stage of the game.

In the mid-game, teams will start to group. Vex is good in team fights and she will be quite a big threat

Keep securing picks with your overall burst and Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}} in the game. This will help you single-handedly take over fights if you use your abilities and Passive correctly.

Try to set up death brushes when possible. Your {{championSpells.VexW}} will easily fear enemies when combined with your Passive, and then you can proceed to blow them up.

Stick with your team and take fights in or around chokepoints for maximal effectiveness. This will allow you to get multiple kills in a brief period and eventually win the game.

At level 14, Vex will finish upgrading her second ability. Again, her damage output and overall threat will increase.

Pretty much every champion spikes at level 16 when they put the 3rd point in their Ultimate {{championSpells.VexR}}.

Teams will be grouping in the late game. Vex is good in team fights, so she should do pretty well in late game team fights.

Her early game Jungle power is a force to be reckoned with as she dishes out a lot of damage in any duel if she manages to land all her abilities. Her {{championSpells.ViW}} allows her to tank with ease too.

Very good objective control and sustain due to her Passive and her damage. Can easily get her team an early dragon lead, after successfully ganking a lane with her {{championSpells.ViQ}}.

Her Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}} can allow her to focus a target down, which has two uses depending on her role in the game. Either she can use it to peel someone off her carries, or she can use it to get to a high priority carry (like Vayne for instance).

Pre-6, if Vi misses her {{championSpells.ViQ}} when trying to gank a lane, she will have nothing to follow up with. She will be over extended and may even die for it.

Her kit allows her to go in like a champ but she will have no way out after that. If she goes in too deep, she can easily be killed, which will translate to easy objectives for the enemy team.

Falls off during the late game due to all the enemies building defenses. She is then left to either peel for her team or look for flanks in order to assassinate the enemy carry (probably at the expense of her own life).

Your goal in the early game is to gank as often as possible to get your allies ahead. You are a strong early game Jungler, so make sure you try to exploit your early advantage.

Look to secure objectives whenever they’re up. This will give your team an advantage as the game goes along.

Find a healthy balance between ganking your allies, farming your jungle and securing objectives. Make sure you do not fall behind in XP by trying to constantly gank.

Vi's early game ganks are pretty decent due to her {{championSpells.ViQ}}. She will just have to play around with vision to ensure that she doesn't get detected while charging up her {{championSpells.ViQ}}.

Level 6 is a massive power spike for Vi. She will be able to single out enemies and burst them down. The CC is quite beneficial as well as it helps her team follow up on Vi's engagement.

Vi has great objective control with her Passive, {{championSpells.ViW}}, and {{championSpells.ViE}}. This means that she will melt through objectives and completely take over the game.

Continue to pick up and secure jungle camps whenever possible. Not falling behind in the mid-game is crucial as a Jungler, so make sure you continue to farm!

As you’re a Jungler, you need to try and secure every Drake during the mid-game. Getting them and securing the Dragon Soul for your team will increase your chances of winning the game.

Look for picks with your team. If you can pick someone off, make the call for Baron or Dragon to further your lead.

Vi has excellent pick potential with her Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}}. The range allows her to catch enemies off-guard with her Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}} and kill her targets due to her burst damage.

Vi's objective control will still be preserved during this phase of the game. This means that she can quickly melt through towers with her {{championSpells.ViE}} and take neutral objectives with ease.

Her impact will be massive during the mid-game. This is because she will have her core items, and she will be able to pick enemies off with ease with her Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}}. She can easily flank the enemy and get to their backline.

After going in with your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}}, be prepared to fall back and peel for your allies in late game team fights.

To make getting on the enemy backline easier, group with your team but stay off to the side. If you flank from an unwarded bush, the enemy will find it harder to react to your all-in. Avoid splitting or being away from your team in the late game as the enemy will force a fight while you’re gone.

Play around your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}} in the later parts of the game. Avoid fighting unless your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}} is up. Fighting with out it will make the late game team fights much harder. Delay fights and be prepared to disengage if it’s still on cooldown.

Vi's pick potential will still be preserved during this stage of the game. She should be able to get into the backline and lockdown high-priority targets with ease as well.

She will now have three points in her Ultimate {{championSpells.ViR}}. This means that Vi can easily use the ability to lock down enemies in a frequent fashion. Any squishy enemy target will have a hard time playing the game.

This is the point of the game where Vi starts to fall off. This means that she will have to focus on peeling for her carries or acting as an engager when possible.

Viego can steal the lives of his enemies which can allow him to escape danger. As he becomes untargetable, it can allow him to dodge incoming damage. 

Viego is a fun and rewarding champion to play thanks to his Passive and his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}. Expect yourself to get hooked on him quite quickly.

Viego has a high skill ceiling. This means the more effort you put into him, the better you will be at him. Keep playing him and see yourself skyrocket in the ranks

Viego’s Passive is only as strong as the enemy team composition. If is picked into a team that lacks a lot of damage, transforming into them might be uneventful. 

Viego is a difficult champion to master: in particular, playing around your Passive and your {{championSpells.ViegoR}} can be quite challenging for beginners.

Viego has low utility and his {{championSpells.ViegoW}} cannot help him get over walls. This is a drawback compared to other mobile champions in the current meta.

Just focus on farming during this phase of the game. You want to hit your mid-game powerspike very quickly, and farming your camps is an effective way of doing it.

Try to gank lanes that you are near to, especially if the enemy is pushed up. The same rule applies for counter ganks, but ensure that your {{championSpells.ViegoW}} and {{championSpells.ViegoE}} are up before ganking.

If you happen to be on the other side of the map when the enemy jungler is ganking your laners, just try to make sure that you invade the enemy jungle and steal as many camps as you can. This way, you won't fall behind.

Viego's ganks are quite potent early on. He really shines when dealing with overextended enemies during the early game. His {{championSpells.ViegoW}} and {{championSpells.ViegoE}} should help him a lot.

Level 6 is a massive power spike as it allows him to escape from botched fights and use it aggressively when needed. It will also make it easier for him to take over enemy champions.

Viego has really great objective control because his abilities do a lot of damage and that he can melt through them very quickly. He should try to gank his bot lane, get the enemy to recall, and then ask for assistance when trying to kill the neutral objective.

Once you get your core items, you should participate in multiple fights. This is crucial for you to take over the game.

Your {{championSpells.ViegoE}} will come in very handy while making plays during this period of the game. Always look for opportunities to play around vision and flank the enemies.

Take a good look at what your team is missing during fights and use your Passive accordingly. Generally, it is better to transform into the most fed member of the enemy team.

Viego is pretty decent during team fights due to his {{championSpells.ViegoW}} and {{championSpells.ViegoQ}}. His life steal will help him during full-blown fights, and his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will act as a decent finishing move.

Viego will gain a massive power spike once he gets two points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}. He can run down squishy targets, execute them and use his Passive for much longer than any other champion in his situation.

He will have his core items by this phase of the game. He should be able to dish out a lot of damage and catch enemies off-guard with his {{championSpells.ViegoW}}. His {{championSpells.ViegoE}} should help him pull off multiple ganks as well.

You should be a monster during this phase of the game if you have your items. Participate in team fights actively and always aim for the enemy backline.

Use your {{championSpells.ViegoE}} to flank or zone out enemies from areas like the objective pits. If you see the enemy Jungler walking close to you, deal with them first.

Your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will be very important during this phase of the game. It can help you survive near-death situations, especially if you are targeting the enemy backline. Just make sure that you activate your Passive before dying.

Viego will have 3 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} now, which will make him deal a lot of damage and will allow him to execute enemies with ease. This will come in handy during fights.

Viego will have multiple items by now. This will increase his damage and sustain and make it very hard for the enemy to kill him without CC.

Viego will have two of his abilities maxed out when he hits level 14. This means that his damage output will be really high, and he will ultimately take over the game.

Viego can steal the lives of his enemies which can allow him to escape danger. As he becomes untargetable, it can allow him to dodge incoming damage.

Viego has a high skill ceiling. This means the more effort you put into him, the better you will be at him. Keep playing him and see yourself skyrocket in the ranks

Viego has low utility and his {{championSpells.ViegoW}} cannot help him get over walls. This is a drawback compared to other mobile champions in the current meta.

Just focus on farming while keeping the wave on your side of the lane. You do not want to overextend, as you will definitely be ganked.

You should go for short burst trades when possible. Use your {{championSpells.ViegoE}} on the side walls to ensure that you can use the stealth function to escape sticky situations.

Once you get your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}, you should look to fight more often. Just make sure you warm up properly; else, you will most probably get ganked.

Level six is a massive power spike as Viego will be able to unlock a powerful finishing ability. It can help a lot in clutch situations where Viego needs to execute his target quickly.

His early kill pressure is really high since all he needs to do is land his {{championSpells.ViegoW}} and then follow it up with his {{championSpells.ViegoQ}} and auto-attacks. This combo becomes way more devastating once Viego gets his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}.

His first item component will give him a massive boost in solo laning. He will be able to look for all-ins frequently and can completely decimate any immobile mid-laner.

Once you get your core item, you should look to duel the enemy as much as possible. If the enemy is playing too safe, roam to some other lane.

Helping your jungle should be really easy for you due to your {{championSpells.ViegoE}}. Don't waste any time going to objective fights, as you may be able to get a huge lead there.

Your {{championSpells.ViegoW}} will play a pivotal role during this phase of the game. Always make sure that you land it on a high-priority target, as it can help you secure picks quickly.

Having 2 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will make it easier for Viego to kill his targets. It will help him a lot during team fights and skirmishes near the objective pits.

His first ability will be maxed out at level 9. This will give him a massive boost to his skirmishing potential. He will be powerful when fighting in choke points.

Viego is good in team fights as he can move quickly through his {{championSpells.ViegoE}}, CC crucial targets with his {{championSpells.ViegoW}}, and gain multi-kills with his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}.

Getting a complete build will allow your damage to skyrocket. Don't forget to use your Passive timely to avoid dying in clustered fights.

You can use your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} as an escape tool in heavily botched-up fights. This is not recommended because ability can allow you to turn a fight and save yourself almost immediately.

Your {{championSpells.ViegoE}} will be pivotal to fights during this phase of the game. Always try to flank the enemy and get kills on the backline. This way, you will be able to take over the game easily.

Having 3 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will help Viego take over the game effortlessly. His burst damage will increase significantly, and he will melt through the enemy team.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will come in very handy during late-game fights. His ability to target the lowest health enemy will make quick work of enemies who have managed to escape with a sliver of health.

Viego is decent in team fights, mainly if he uses the fog of war and his {{championSpells.ViegoE}} to get to the enemy backline. He can even use his {{championSpells.ViegoE}} to zone the enemy off without even trying to kill anyone.

Viego can steal the lives of his enemies which can allow him to escape danger. As he becomes untargetable, it can allow him to dodge incoming damage.

Just focus on farming while keeping the wave on your side of the lane. You do not want to overextend, as you will definitely be ganked.

You should go for short burst trades when possible. Use your {{championSpells.ViegoE}} on the side walls to ensure that you can use the stealth function to escape sticky situations.

Once you get your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}, you should look to fight more often. Just make sure you warm up properly; else, you will most probably get ganked.

Level six is a massive power spike as Viego will be able to unlock a powerful finishing ability. It can help a lot in clutch situations where Viego needs to execute his target quickly.

His early kill pressure is really high since all he needs to do is land his {{championSpells.ViegoW}} and then follow it up with his {{championSpells.ViegoQ}} and auto-attacks. This combo becomes way more devastating once Viego gets his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}.

His first item component will give him a massive boost in solo laning. He will be able to look for all-ins frequently and can completely decimate any immobile mid-laner.

Once you get your core item, you should look to duel the enemy as much as possible. If the enemy is playing too safe, roam to some other lane.

Helping your jungle should be really easy for you due to your {{championSpells.ViegoE}}. Don't waste any time going to objective fights, as you may be able to get a huge lead there.

Your {{championSpells.ViegoW}} will play a pivotal role during this phase of the game. Always make sure that you land it on a high-priority target, as it can help you secure picks quickly.

Having 2 points in his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will make it easier for Viego to kill his targets. It will help him a lot during team fights and skirmishes near the objective pits.

His first ability will be maxed out at level 9. This will give him a massive boost to his skirmishing potential. He will be powerful when fighting in choke points.

Viego is good in team fights as he can move quickly through his {{championSpells.ViegoE}}, CC crucial targets with his {{championSpells.ViegoW}}, and gain multi-kills with his Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}}.

Getting a complete build will allow your damage to skyrocket. Don't forget to use your Passive timely to avoid dying in clustered fights.

You can use your Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} as an escape tool in heavily botched-up fights. This is not recommended because ability can allow you to turn a fight and save yourself almost immediately.

His Ultimate {{championSpells.ViegoR}} will come in very handy during late-game fights. His ability to target the lowest health enemy will make quick work of enemies who have managed to escape with a sliver of health.

Viego is decent in team fights, mainly if he uses the fog of war and his {{championSpells.ViegoE}} to get to the enemy backline. He can even use his {{championSpells.ViegoE}} to zone the enemy off without even trying to kill anyone.

Very efficient wave clear which also allows him to damage multiple enemies at the same time. This gives him an innate advantage against ranged matchups, as well as lane priority in general.

Can disrupt an entire fight with his {{championSpells.ViktorGravitonField}} and Ultimate {{championSpells.ViktorChaosStorm}}, so fighting in close spaces is very advantageous for him. He can also chase a single target down with some fancy footwork, by using his {{championSpells.ViktorPowerTransfer}}.

His poke damage is obnoxious and very strong. This can allow him to force his enemy laner out of the lane and then take objectives with a numbers advantage. In the bot lane, he can use the lane brushes for an added effect of obscurity from enemy laners.

His {{championSpells.ViktorGravitonField}} is the only form of self-peel for him. Once that ability is down, he is quite vulnerable to ganks. In team fights, he can be flanked with ease as well.

He will be trying to play safe during the early game and will not have a lot of damage if he can’t upgrade his Passive Core. Playing aggressively and forcing him out of the lane early on can allow his enemy to get a huge advantage on him.

Very prone to all-ins, especially in the bot lane when against a hard crowd control Support. He has some form of movement speed buff with his {{championSpells.ViktorPowerTransfer}} but layered crowd control can easily counter that.

Focus on farming and getting as much gold and XP as possible. You need time and gold before you’re able to come online and deal damage.

Your champion is incredibly weak in the early game. Focus on farming and avoid fighting with the enemy until you’ve got an item behind you.

After your bot lane has moved to the mid lane, rotate to the bot side of the map or somewhere else on the map so you can continue to farm and gain XP. Do not fight anyone unless you have an advantage over them. Continue to get XP and gold.

If your allies move to your lane after destroying their tower, rotate and move around the map to continue farming and gaining XP and gold.

At level 9, Warwick will max out his first ability, which is usually his {{championSpells.WarwickQ}}. The extra sustain and damage it gives this ability will make him a huge threat to the enemy.

During the mid-game, Warwick can be a strong split pusher: using his insane 1v1 potential and movement speed to escape scary situations while he is overextended.

Use your {{championSpells.WarwickW}} to snuff out enemies during this phase of the game but ensure that your team is there to follow you up should you look for an engage.

Always try to Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}} the enemy Jungler during this phase of the game. It will allow your team to get a free Dragon off after managing to kill the Jungler.

Be extremely careful when looking for all-ins. Get a defensive item to ensure that you can sustain for a longer period in fights.

Warwick will put the third point in his Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}}. It will be on a low cooldown and will be a great tool at picking off the enemy in the late parts of the game.

Warwick will be very tanky in the late game so he will be able to soak up a lot of enemy damage.

At level 14, he would’ve maxed 2 abilities at this stage of the game. This is a significant power spike for Warwick.

Extremely healthy clears early on which allows him to gank overextended lanes quite easily. He can also prioritize taking objectives quickly and starving the enemy Jungler off of farm.

His {{championSpells.WarwickE}} can allow him to take reduced damage in team fights as well as disrupt a fight with the fear on his {{championSpells.WarwickE}}. This can allow him to change the tide of a fight quite easily.

His {{championSpells.WarwickW}} can allow him to detect low health enemies on the map. He can then use this information and communicate with his team. This can allow him to take free objectives and secure kills on unsuspecting enemies.

Can’t gank effectively until he gets his Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}}. This gives a huge window where enemy laners can easily get a lead on Warwick’s allies.

His {{championSpells.WarwickE}} forms a major part of his kit which allows him to dive into the enemy team. Without this, he can’t do much so keeping a track on this ability’s usage will allow his enemies to counter Warwick quite easily.

Warwick’s {{championSpells.WarwickQ}} can carry him to the enemy champion, but this can be used against him as bait. Any champion with a blink or dash can easily displace him under their tower and put him in a very disadvantageous position.

Focus on farming and hitting level 6 as quickly as you can. You need to hit level 6 as fast as possible to increase your ganking potential.

Your Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}} is an incredibly strong tool. Whenever it is up, try to use it to help your allies and get kills.

Try to secure objectives with your team. If you can, try to keep it warded at all times if you’re not in a position to take it yourself.

Warwick can gank pretty well early on, especially if he manages to hit level three and gets access to all his abilities. Once that is done, he should be able to shut down overextended enemies with ease.

Level 6 is a massive power spike as it allows him to pick targets off. The range on that ability is enormous, making it quite effective from the fog of war.

Warwick's objective control is really high. This is mainly due to his {{championSpells.WarwickQ}} healing, which allows him to take neutral objectives really fast.

Continue to pick up and secure jungle camps whenever possible. Not falling behind in the mid-game is crucial as a Jungler, so make sure you continue to farm!

As you’re a Jungler, you need to try and secure every Drake during the mid-game. Getting them and securing the Dragon Soul for your team will increase your chances of winning the game.

Look for picks with your team. If you can pick someone off, make the call for Baron or Dragon to further your lead.

At level 11, he will have access to his level two Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}}. This will allow him to use his Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}} more frequently while increasing the healing and damage dealt with the help of that ability.

The first ability will get maxed out at level 9. At that point, Warwick will become really powerful. He will be able to sustain himself easily while doing primary objectives or taking part in significant fights.

Warwick is extremely good at making picks, thanks to his Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}}. This helps him make picks from the fog of war which will definitely catch enemies off guard.

After going in with your Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}}, be prepared to fall back and peel for your allies in late game team fights.

To make getting on the enemy backline easier, group with your team but stay off to the side. If you flank from an unwarded bush, the enemy will find it harder to react to your all-in. Avoid splitting or being away from your team in the late game as the enemy will force a fight while you’re gone.

Play around your Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}} in the later parts of the game. Avoid fighting unless your Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}} is up. Fighting without it will make the late game team fights much harder. Delay fights and be prepared to disengage if it’s still on cooldown.

Once Warwick manages to get the third point into his Ultimate {{championSpells.WarwickR}}, he will be ganking and picking enemies off throughout the map. Any immobile enemy will be highly unsafe now.

Warwick will deal a lot of damage while being extremely tanky along with it. This means that he can both serve as an engager as well as a peeler for his team.

At level 14, two of his abilities will be completely maxed out. This will be an augmentation to his overall gank potential, and Warwick will benefit significantly from it.

Late game monster if her team peels for her. She will want to farm early on and try to get some kills early on which will allow her to snowball easily.

Very immobile during the entirety of the game and can be shut down early on. She is very prone to ganks as well.

Her {{championSpells.XayahE}} forms a vital part of her kit. Once that ability is down, the enemy can all-in her with ease and secure a kill on her.

Play safe for the first few levels. You need time to come online and you shouldn’t be fighting unless you have a clear early advantage.

After destroying the bottom lane tower, rotate to the mid lane and try to take that tower. This will open up the map and give your team a gold lead.

Once you have a few levels under your belt, you can start to play aggressive and look for aggressive plays. You benefit from extended trades, so try to go for them frequently.

Her first item component will increase her dueling and survivability significantly. Her ability to dish out damage in the lane will also increase significantly.

Each point in her {{championSpells.XayahE}} will allow her to deal a lot more damage to her enemies. Her daggers will hurt a lot and will easily catch enemies off-guard.

Once she gets level six, she will deal a lot of damage to her enemies. She will also be able to self-peel, and combined with her Flash and {{championSpells.XayahE}}, she can catch many people off-guard.

Try and stick with your Support throughout the mid-game. You’re quite vulnerable and easy to kill if you’re on your own. By staying with your Support, your survivability will increase.

Continue picking up farm in the side lanes when no team fights are occurring, but spend as little time away from your team. You need gold and XP to buy items and if you fall behind, it will be unlikely that you’ll be able to dish out damage in fights.

Look for picks with your Support/Jungler to get kills and increase your lead. If you kill a key target, you could make the call for Baron.

Once she has 2 points in her Ultimate {{championSpells.XayahR}}, she will be able to burst down enemies quickly, and she will also be able to use it frequently to keep her safe.

Her first ability will be maxed out at level 9. This will significantly boost her damage and will let her one-shot squishies if they are not careful about her {{championSpells.XayahE}}.

Xayah is really decent during team fights as she can dish out tons of consistent damage with her {{championSpells.XayahW}} and {{championSpells.XayahE}}. She just needs to position herself well.

Just like in the mid-game, you should stick with your Support throughout the later parts of the game. Do not go around the map alone as you will die easily.

Do not play super aggressive in team fights. Just kite and auto-attack the nearest enemy champion. If you walk too far forward, the enemy will focus you and take you down.

Continue to kite in team fights and consistently adapt your positioning. Avoid standing still in fights as you’ll be an easy target.

Three points in her Ultimate {{championSpells.XayahR}} will give her a huge power spike. The ability will be up frequently, allowing her to use it defensively to get away from bad situations.

Her life steal combined with her damage during the late game will make her really good in team fights. She will just need to maintain proper positioning and use her {{championSpells.XayahE}} at the right time.

Xerath will have a maxed-out {{championSpells.XerathArcaneBarrage2}} when he hits level thirteen. This will deal with increased damage and allow Xerath to chain his {{championSpells.XerathArcanopulseChargeUp}} along with it. The result will be a massive chunk of damage.
